SUMMARY

The Security Engineer’s primary role is designing and building effective technical and procedural security solutions for the company and its clients. For the organization’s internal security, the Security Engineer develops and implements security frameworks and compliance solutions such as NIST, HIPAA, PCI-DSS, SOX, etc. They will participate and contribute in design of firewall, IDS, IPS, Endpoint Security, SIEM, Phishing, and other company security platforms. They also advise on security policy for the organization and assist Legal with reviewing technical aspects of security contracts to ensure compliance is maintained.

As part of the IT Infrastructure team, the Security Engineer maintains the organization’s competitive edge in the security marketplace through best practices in security methodology, and staying ahead of product popularity, current events, and known incidents that cause potential security risks.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Creates formal documentation for internal security use of defined security responsibilities, including firewalls, proxy systems, logging, and other security devices. Reviews systems to determine if they have been designed to comply with established security frameworks. Develops new standards as necessary. Works with department heads on practicing security standards and best practices.
  • Ensures Security best practices are being followed for authentication, authorization, secure coding, and encryption solutions. Designs, deploys, maintains, and manages new applications and enhancements to existing appliances and software.
  • Leads technology research of new products, techniques, countermeasures, and trends in the security space.
  • Makes recommendations in terms of business risks and rewards to the organization for new products and services and drives that concept into the product description. Communicates if tradeoffs exist and how to balance them.
  • Interacts and negotiates with vendors, outsourcing partners, and contractors to obtain security-related products and services. Establishes and manages relations with vendors and related equipment suppliers.
  • Develops products for the future intent of operating in the Managed Security Service Provider (MSSP) model. Prepares Managed Security solutions to flow through Lean Launch.
  • Manages the enterprise adherence to SOX, PCI, HIPAA and NIST. This includes annual PCI Audit and Quarterly/Semi Annual Internal SOX Audits.
  • Performs vulnerability testing, risk analysis, and security assessments on internal systems and assets. Verifies remediation of vulnerabilities by reproducing the exploit (ethical hacking) and providing documentation of remediation. Gauges the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems; develops and implements strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems. Manages and coordinates the annual third-party pen test, applying vendor research and comparison techniques to this project also.
  • Investigates and responds to intrusion incidents as defined in the IH&R policy. Conducts digital forensic investigations and mounts incident responses. Creates and reviews reports on security incidents.
  • Acts as primary First responder to Security events in Security Endpoint Protection, SIEM, and others. Serves as top-level support and technical security trainer for the organization. Provides guidance to Support groups and other Engineering staff.
  • Acts as a member of the corporate Security Council. Assists in the enforcement and monitoring of security frameworks and compliance regulations. Recommends modifications in legal, technical, and regulatory areas that affect organizational security.
  • Designs and conducts training for corporate security education and awareness programs. Provides orientation and training to end users for all modified and new systems.
  • Performs other related duties incidental to the work described herein.

QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE Bachelor’s Degree (B.A.) from a four-year college or university preferred; 2 - 5 years Security-related work required. Security Certifications: CND, Security+, GSEC or higher certification will set you apart; Compliance Certifications: PCI, SOX, ITIL; Experience required with firewall administration especially NGFW or UTM, endpoint security software configuration and deployment, IDS/IPS configuration and administration, Experience with SIP (VoIP) security is preferred, Proven experience in overseeing the design, development, and implementation of security products, and internally used systems. Proven experience with implementing security policies and best practices, 3 years’ experience in a Windows Server environment, experience working with Linux/Unix systems, particularly CentOS/Red Hat Enterprise Linux and Debian preferred but not required. Intermediate networking skills involving VLANS, CIDR Notation, LAN/WAN, DHCP, DNS, RADIUS, Basic knowledge of scripting languages: bash, Perl, Python, PowerShell. Excellent understanding of the organization’s goals and objectives. Knowledge and experience with applicable data privacy practices and laws. Good project management skills. Ability to conduct research into systems issues and products as required. Highly self-motivated and directed, with keen attention to detail. Must be able to independently research and advise on security trends as they will change quickly. Able to prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment. Strong customer service orientation.

Please review the following job description:

Responsible for developing and maintaining the technical IT/cyber security capabilities necessary for safeguarding the firm's information systems and applications (software development lifecycle), including every phase of the SDLC and software stack. Assist in the designing, planning, testing and implementation phases of cybersecurity technology projects.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.

1. Develop and maintain the technical IT/cyber capabilities including all phases of the software development lifecycle and software stack which includes threat modeling of application designs, static application security testing (SAST), software composition analysis (SCA), dynamic application security testing (DAST), and penetration testing.

2. Participate in efforts related to designing, planning, enhancing, and testing all cybersecurity technologies used throughout the enterprise including base-lining current systems, trend analysis, and capacity planning as required for future systems requirements and new technologies.

3. Participate in the analysis of information to determine, recommend, and plan the use of new technologies, or modifications to existing equipment and systems that will provide capability for proposed project or work load, efficient operation and effective use of allotted resources

4. Participate in the implementation of new information security technologies or integration of existing technologies including initial configuration, installation, change management, and operational handoff

5. Take a new perspective on existing solutions to solve complex problems and exercise judgment based on the analysis (e.g. modeling, testing, etc.) of multiple sources of information.

6. Provide technical support of information security technologies, providing problem analysis and resolution in a timely manner and explain and interpret complex, difficult, or sensitive information.

7. Lead small cybersecurity projects with manageable risks and resource requirements; plays significant roles in larger, more complex initiatives.

Qualifications

Required Qualifications:

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

1. Bachelor’s degree and five years of experience in systems engineering or administration or an equivalent combination of education and work experience

2. In-depth knowledge in applied enterprise information security technologies including but not limited to firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, network operating systems, identity management, database activity monitoring, encryption, content filtering, and Mainframe security

3. Previous experience in planning and managing IT projects

Preferred Qualifications:

1. Bachelor’s degree and six years of experience or an equivalent combination of education and work experience

2. Banking or financial services experience

3. For a Build Engineer: Experience creating build definitions. Experience with setting up branching approach, defining merging approach. Experience supporting configuration of automated unit testing. Experience supporting configuration of build package, providing oversight when a build is checked-in into the CI server, handling build dependency impediments raised by the team. Experience managing the build process for multiple releases

Example of Duties

Purpose of Classification:

The purpose of this classification it to provide 2nd level support for desktop, laptops, tablets and audio visual technology devices provisioned to Fulton County facilities, employees and citizens. This position will be responsible for troubleshooting and resolving issues on these devices, as well as ensuring the performance, functionality and integrity of all devices are maintained.

Essential Functions:

The following duties are normal for this position. The omission of specific statements of the duties does not exclude them from the classification if the work is similar, related, or a logical assignment for this classification. Other duties may be required and assigned.

Responds to service desk incidents for endpoint devices (personal computers, tablets, printers and audio visual equipment) not resolved by level 1 service desk analysts; Diagnoses and resolves issues reporting through the IT help desk for end point devices provisioned by Fulton County IT; Escalate incidents to the Service Desk Manager and/or the Technical Operations Manager to ensure issues are resolved in a timely manner; assesses systematic issues to the attention of management and assists in developing and implementing proactive configuration or design changes; Manages and configures of endpoint management software; installs and configures endpoint management software, test & verifies endpoint images to be deployed by endpoint management software.

Perform upgrades, patching and configuration of endpoint devices through the use of management tools such as SCCM and Airwatch; Develops and test endpoint configuration changes and upgrades procedures and packages utilizing endpoint management software; applies upgrades and configuration changes to endpoint devices utilizing endpoint management software.

Develop job aides for service desk technicians; analyzed common incidents and develops job aids for 1st call resolution or diagnosis; Reviews and trains Service desk staff on the use of job aides; Maintains advanced knowledge of PC and Mac operating systems and general competency with office-related technology devices (e.g. printers, scanners, mobile devices) proven knowledge of Android and/or iOS mobile operating systems; Prepare, evaluate and submit service desk, cost estimates, systematic issues related reports.

Correct/diagnose root causes of an endpoint devise problem and implement the proper solution, properly assess the impact and criticality of the reported problem; Recognizes when a reported problems is an indication of a systematic issue not related to the personal computer and refer it to the appropriate support staff; Identify errors in system management tools and the impact all the endpoint devices managed by the software and potentially all such devices in the organization.

Stays abreast of laws, rules regulations and standards such as IETF, PCI, HIPPA, FISMA and NIST; Operates computer software to edit, review, analyze, report manage, or modify data, utilize word processing, spreadsheet, database, desktop configuration and application deploy windows images and desktop applications.

Additional Functions:

Performs other related duties as required.


Minimum Qualifications

Performance Aptitudes:

Data Utilization: Requires the ability to evaluate, assign work, review, audit, deduce, and/or assess data using established criteria. Includes exercising discretion in determining actual or probable consequences and in referencing such evaluation to identify and select alternatives.

Human Interaction: Requires the ability to work and communicate will with others, consult with other information technology professional; must be smart, creative, inventive and proactive to coordinate applications, programs and problems associated with the responsibilities of the job. Often represents the department and/or organization when dealing with others.

Equipment, Machinery, Tools, and Materials Utilization: Requires the ability to operate and control the actions of equipment and machinery, requiring the monitoring, adjustment, regulation, and/or setting of multiple conditions.

Verbal Aptitude: Requires the ability to utilize a wide variety of reference, descriptive, advisory and/or design data and information.

Mathematical Aptitude: Requires the ability to perform addition, subtraction, multiplication and division; ability to calculate decimals and percentages; may include ability to perform mathematical operations with fractions; may include ability to compute discount, interest, and ratios; may include ability to calculate surface areas, volumes, weights, and measures.

Functional Reasoning: Requires the ability to apply principles of influence systems, such as motivation, incentive, and leadership, and to exercise independent judgment to apply facts and principles for developing approaches and techniques to resolve endpoint device problems.

Situational Reasoning: Requires the ability to exercise judgment, decisiveness and creativity in situations involving the evaluation of information against sensory, judgmental, or subjective criteria, as opposed to that which is clearly measurable or verifiable.


Supplemental Information

It is the policy of Fulton County that there will be equal opportunity for every citizen, employee and applicant, based upon merit without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, genetics, disability or sexual orientation.

Overview:

As a cybersecurity engineer, you will be responsible for ensuring the security and integrity of our organization's information systems and networks. You will work closely with the IT and security teams to implement and maintain effective security measures, identify vulnerabilities, and respond to security incidents. Your role will involve planning, implementing, and monitoring security protocols and procedures to protect our systems from unauthorized access, cyber threats, and data breaches.


The Security Engineer position is responsible for carrying out technical tasks and designing technical solutions required for securing data that is property of PT Solutions and its patients.


As a healthcare cybersecurity engineer, you will be responsible for protecting the sensitive data and critical systems of our healthcare organization. You will work closely with the IT and security teams to develop, implement, and maintain effective security measures that adhere to healthcare industry regulations and standards. Your role will involve safeguarding patient information, securing medical devices, and ensuring the overall integrity of our healthcare IT infrastructure.


The Security Engineer will need to have a strong understanding of Information Security best practices and a wide range of technical knowledge.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS


Cybersecurity Program Support and Improvement

  • Contribute to the development and maintenance of policies, procedures, standards, and guidelines (PPS&G) that support the PTS cybersecurity program in an advisory capacity.
  • Coordinate with Privacy and Compliance to ensure enterprise-wide alignment of PPS&G.
  • Advise middle management and compliance on risk levels, security posture, cost/benefit analysis of security programs.

Information Security Support

  • Healthcare security framework: Implement and maintain security controls and frameworks specific to the healthcare industry, such as the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) and the Health Information Trust Alliance (HITRUST) framework.
  • Provide hands-on technical support of security products where MSSP is not applicable
  • Perform system maintenance on SIEM system hosted in PT Solution’s network
  • Healthcare security framework: Implement and maintain security controls and frameworks specific to the healthcare industry, such as the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) and the Health Information Trust Alliance (HITRUST) framework.
  • Monitor and review logs generated by all PT Solution’s systems to hunt for malicious patterns
  • Perform occasional audits of PT Solutions environment based on a guide developed by ISM
  • Design and implement secure architectures for healthcare IT systems and networks. Collaborate with system administrators and network engineers to integrate security controls seamlessly.
  • Act as escalation point for Security Analyst

Incident Response

  • Work with ISM to perform incident response outside of the responsibility of MSSP
  • Unexpected System Downtime
  • Infection of system
  • Loss of confidential data
  • Loss of PT Solution’s-owned equipment
  • Support development and maintenance of program documentation, including policies, plans, and procedures for incident response.
  • Coordinate with security service providers to support timely response for confirmed security events detected internally and externally.

Vendor Management Program

  • Serve as the technical contact for third-party security service providers (Managed Security Services Provider).
  • Carry out remediations described by risk assessments at the discretion of the ISM
  • Provide findings and recommendations to ensure procurement stakeholders understand the security risk associated with planned acquisitions.

Vulnerability Management

  • Coordinate with IT to ensure timely execution of enterprise patching.
  • Facilitate vulnerability assessment using approved security tools to support vulnerability management, change management, and solution development.
  • Manage assessment and reporting for Microsoft 365 Security Assessments


DESIRED SKILLS & ABILITIES

  • Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, information security, or a related field.
  • Professional certifications such as
    • ISC2 CISSP
    • ISC2 CISSP-ISSEP
    • ISC2 HCISSP
    • CEH
    • CISM
    • GSLC
    • GISP
  • Experience in healthcare cybersecurity, preferably in a healthcare provider or related organization.
  • Strong knowledge of healthcare industry regulations and standards, including HIPAA, HITRUST, and the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
  • Familiarity with healthcare IT systems, electronic health records (EHRs), medical devices, and healthcare-specific software.
  • Experience with vulnerability assessment and penetration testing in healthcare environments.
  • Understanding of security frameworks such as NIST, ISO 27001, and CIS Critical Security Controls.
  • Knowledge of healthcare-specific threat landscape, attack vectors, and security controls for medical devices.
  • Proficiency in security technologies such as firewalls, intrusion detection systems, SIEM tools, and endpoint protection solutions.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with healthcare professionals, compliance teams, and IT staff.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects and initiatives in a dynamic healthcare environment.
  • Strong knowledge of best practices for data encryption, protection and firewalls in order to protect sensitive data
  • Security appliance configuration deployment and monitoring
  • Knowledge, skills, and abilities to execute tasks for troubleshooting enterprise security systems
  • Knowledge of networking ports and protocols to identify odd/malicious traffic in logs
  • Knowledge of current and emerging industry methods for evaluating, implementing, and disseminating IT security assessment, monitoring, detection, and remediation tools and procedures utilizing standards-based concepts and capabilities
  • Monitor the health of information systems on a daily basis and enhancement of PTS Security measures following any potential or confirmed attack including written detailed reports about such attacks
  • Knowledge of business continuity and disaster recovery continuity of operations plans
  • Knowledge of data backup and recovery in conjunction with the Infrastructure and Operational leadership team including Managed Services Providers
  • Knowledge of PCI and PHI data security standards (heavily focused on HITRUST requirements)
  • Ability to advise middle management on findings derived from internal audits
  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize
  • Excellent written and oral communication
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Excellent time management and organization skills
  • Resourcefulness and willing to find solutions
  • Motivated to be a team player


MUST HAVES

  • 3-5 years’ experience
  • Certifications (at least one)
    • CompTIA Security +
    • CompTIA CySA+
    • ISC2 Certified in Cybersecurity
    • GSEC
    • GFACT
    • GISF
    • Cisco Certified CyberOps Associate
    • ECSA
    • MTA
    • CSCU

InfoSec Engineer

Designs and implements security measures to protect systems, networks, and applications. Identifies vulnerabilities, evaluates risks, and implements security measures such as firewalls, intrusion detection systems, and antivirus software.

Develops security policies and procedures to ensure that information assets are protected.

Establishes policies around access control, data classification, incident response, and disaster recovery.

Conducts security audits and risk assessments to identify vulnerabilities and risks.

Analyzes data from security tools such as vulnerability scanners and penetration testing tools to identify areas of weakness. Implements security controls such as access controls, encryption, and data loss prevention to protect the organizational data.

Ensures that security controls are in place and are functioning as intended.

Responds to security incidents such as cyber attacks and data breaches.

Investigates security incidents, identifies the root cause, and implements corrective measures.

Provides security training and awareness to employees.

Develops and delivers training programs on security best practices, phishing awareness, and other security topics. Stays up-to-date with the latest security trends and technologies.

Researches new threats and vulnerabilities, and evaluates new security tools and technologies.

Job Description The Cyber Security Engineer position will focus on healthcare and medical device security. The successful candidate will join our dynamic team and play a critical role in ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of our healthcare systems and medical devices. This individual will work closely with the Network infrastructure team and business units to provide security planning and technical support.

Experience
5+ years total experience and solid understanding of any combination of the following
Network Security Protocols and Methodologies with Supporting and with building VPN Tunnels required
Performing IDS / IPS real-time monitoring analysis and/or network forensics required
Managing and supporting Egress, Ingress, and Next Generation Firewalls required
Network administration as well as systems administration required
Solid understanding of the Information Security & IT controls, Security penetration and vulnerability assessments
Support and monitoring of security endpoints/servers such as patch deployment/risk assessment/vulnerability scanners/security incident and event monitoring solutions/antivirus products, Network Security Protocols and Methodologies, Information Security & IT controls, security penetration and vulnerability assessments or systems/network administration
Familiarity with HIPAA, Joint Commission, NIST and ISO frameworks, and other information security governing bodies
Experience with NIST and ISO frameworks

Preferred Qualifications
Experience working with medical devices, including familiarity with their security architecture, communication protocols (e.g., DICOM, HL7), and associated security risks.
Familiarity with security standards and frameworks, such as NIST Cybersecurity Framework, ISO 27001, and HITRUST CSF.

In-depth knowledge of healthcare regulatory frameworks, such as HIPAA, HITECH, and FDA guidelines, and their application to cybersecurity.

Education
Bachelors Degree in Computer Sciences or related discipline or equivalent experience required

Certification Summary
No professional certifications required

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Solid knowledge of HIPAA, Joint Commission, and other IT security governing bodies
Demonstrated knowledge of generally known information technology platforms, standards, and software development language(s)
Demonstrate well-developed organizational, written communication and analytical skills
Strong interpersonal skills to interact positively and productively with teams across organizational lines, including administrative, executive staff and patient care systems users
Must be able to function in a dynamic environment subject to impromptu changes in schedules and priorities

Job Responsibilities
Provides leadership and guidance when assisting other team members in problem resolution.
Serves as an expert on matters related to Enterprise Network Security architecture, design, implementation, and ongoing support for the network security devices.
Plans security systems by evaluating network and security technologies; developing requirements for local area networks (LANs), wide area networks (WANs), virtual private networks (VPNs), routers, firewalls, and related security and network devices; designs public key infrastructures (PKIs), including use of certification authorities (CAs) and digital signatures as well as hardware and software; adhering to industry standards.
Implements security systems by specifying intrusion detection methodologies and equipment; directing equipment and software installation and calibration; preparing preventive and reactive measures; creating, transmitting, and maintaining keys; providing technical support; completing documentation.
Verifies security systems by developing and implementing test scripts.
Works closely with the Network infrastructure team and business units to provide security planning and technical support.
Provides system performance monitoring and troubleshooting.
Maintains documentation, asset tracking.

Logistics at full potential.


At GXO, we’re constantly looking for talented individuals at all levels who can deliver the caliber of service our company requires. You know that a positive work environment creates happy employees, which boosts productivity and dedication. On our team, you’ll have the support to excel at work and the resources to build a career you can be proud of.


Are you always on the lookout for innovative ways to reduce the threats facing companies as technology evolves? At GXO Logistics, we are constantly striving to transform an industry through technology, and we need people like you who understand that data security is critical to our success. As the IT Security Engineer, you will perform and facilitate the complex analysis, development, testing and documentation of security methodologies and technologies. We want to utilize your skills, years of experience, dedication and hard work to ensure a forward-thinking future for GXO, while securing a rewarding career for yourself.


Pay, benefits and more.

We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and the opportunity to participate in a company incentive plan.


What you’ll do on a typical day:

  • Initiate and help establish guidelines and controls, including corporate compliance, technical standards and best practices
  • Provide engineering support to all IT and security technical towers
  • Provide security review and analysis of business requirements, as well as design solutions for new and existing applications
  • Create and maintain functional and technical design specifications and solutions to satisfy security project requirements; determine and gather work estimates for security projects
  • Identify and evaluate security vendor software and integration strategies
  • Identify and implement appropriate testing strategies
  • Execute all steps required to deploy/implement the application solution

What you need to succeed at GXO:

At a minimum, you’ll need:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent related work or military experience
  • Minimum 1 year of Information Security Experience.

It’d be great if you also have:

  • Experience in security architecture, including a deep knowledge of computer operating systems, VMware, Windows 7/10, Windows Server (2008 – current), Linux and cloud technologies
  • Experience designing and implementing technical security solutions, such as secure remote access, firewalls, encryption, secure protocols, data protection, data loss prevention and identity management solutions (both internally and within cloud-provided services)
  • Experience designing and incorporating technical security controls that align to industry standards (ISO27001, NIST 800-53r4)
  • Experience designing and managing security controls within service providers and the cloud
  • Proficiency with incident response, threat analysis and governance, risk and compliance
  • Ability to translate business and nonfunctional requirements to establish security controls, ensure a proper security design can be architected, and to document the security solutions for communications and enduring documentation
  • Solid knowledge of data and information flows, information governance and network protocols
  • Knowledge of wider information security-related principles, gained in industry experience or from a consultancy background
  • Proven track record of successfully delivering business requirements on time and within budget constraints
  • Operational and technical experience with all of the following, or your industry equivalents: McAfee Web Gateway, CA Identity Minder, McAfee Suite (HIPS, DLP, AV, etc.), InsightVM/Nexpose, IBM QRadar, Tripwire, HP Fortify, Zscaler Web Proxy, Proofpoint Email Protection/TAP, Tanium Endpoint Protection, Palo Alto Advanced Network IDS/IPS, Cylance Endpoint Protection
  • Experience with CASB products
  • Self-motivated and able to work well with minimal supervision or in a team environment; consult with team members and management as needed

Job Description: Hybrid 2x Week Onsite Endpoint Engineer (JAMF Admin/Engineer) - Contract to Hire

Company Overview: We are a leading financial services company based in Atlanta, dedicated to providing exceptional financial solutions to our clients. As we continue to grow and innovate, we are seeking a skilled and motivated Endpoint Engineer with expertise in JAMF administration and engineering to join our team. This is a hybrid role, requiring the candidate to work onsite at our Atlanta office twice a week.

Position Overview: As a Hybrid 2x Week Onsite Endpoint Engineer (JAMF Admin/Engineer), you will play a critical role in maintaining, optimizing, and securing our endpoint infrastructure, particularly focusing on JAMF management and administration. Your responsibilities will involve managing our fleet of macOS and iOS devices using JAMF Pro, implementing security best practices, troubleshooting endpoint-related issues, and providing top-notch technical support to end-users.

Key Responsibilities:


  • JAMF Administration and Management: Oversee the day-to-day administration of JAMF Pro, ensuring the efficient management and configuration of macOS and iOS devices in compliance with industry best practices.

  • Endpoint Security: Implement and maintain security measures for endpoints, including device encryption, access controls, application whitelisting, and compliance with company security policies.

  • Technical Support: Offer timely and effective technical support to end-users for endpoint-related inquiries, troubleshooting issues, and resolving incidents to ensure minimal disruption to daily operations.

  • Endpoint Optimization: Proactively identify opportunities to enhance endpoint performance, reliability, and user experience by analyzing data, conducting performance reviews, and implementing improvements.

  • Software Deployment and Patch Management: Handle software deployments, updates, and patch management for macOS and iOS devices using JAMF Pro, ensuring all endpoints are up to date and secure.

  • Endpoint Monitoring and Maintenance: Monitor the health and performance of endpoint devices, addressing potential issues promptly, and conducting routine maintenance to prevent downtime.

  • Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate documentation related to endpoint configurations, processes, and troubleshooting procedures. Generate regular reports on endpoint performance, security, and support metrics.

  • Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, security, and operations, to ensure alignment on endpoint-related projects and initiatives.


Requirements:

  • Proven experience as an Endpoint Engineer, JAMF Administrator, or similar role in managing macOS and iOS devices in an enterprise environment.
  • In-depth knowledge and hands-on experience with JAMF Pro, including configuration, management, and automation of macOS and iOS devices.
  • Strong understanding of endpoint security practices, software deployment, and patch management using JAMF Pro.
  • Familiarity with financial industry regulations and compliance standards is a plus.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot complex endpoint-related issues.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with end-users and cross-functional teams.
  • Ability to work onsite at our Atlanta office twice a week as a part of the hybrid arrangement.
  • Relevant certifications, such as JAMF Certified Administrator (JCA), are preferred but not required.

Contract to Hire: This is a contract-to-hire position, providing an opportunity for the right candidate to showcase their skills and potentially transition into a full-time role based on performance and mutual fit.

Our Approach to Flexible Work

With Flex Work, we’re combining the best of both worlds: in-person time and remote. Our approach enables our teams to deepen connections, maintain a strong community, and do their best work. We know that flexibility can take shape in many ways, so rather than a number of required days in-office each week, we simply spend at least half (50%) of our time each quarter in the office or in the field with our customers, prospects, and partners (depending on role). This means you'll have the freedom to create a flexible schedule that caters to your business, team, and personal needs, while being intentional to make the most of time spent together. Those in our remote "home office" roles also have the opportunity to come together in our offices for important moments that matter.

The following duties are normal for this position. The omission of specific statements of the duties does not exclude them from the classification if the work is similar, related, or a logical assignment for this classification. Other duties may be required and assigned.

Alogent is the market leader in providing payment solutions to banks and credit unions. We have over 20 years’ experience in providing the technology, support, and expertise to overcome business challenges in premier financial institutions everywhere such as reliability, efficiency, and quality. Our partnership-based approach to working through business issues has been recognized by our clients and partners, resulting in long-term relationships as their business needs evolve. Alogent continues to forge ahead through the creation of specialized technologies and services that utilize imaging and automation to achieve proven results. Our goal is to be the premier financial technology partner to institutions everywhere.


Alogent is headquartered in Peachtree Corners, GA, with employees across the United States.


JOB OVERVIEW:

We are looking for someone with preferably at least 3 years of previous software engineering experience to join our Development team. The successful candidate will be working in a collaborative development environment with a team of Developers, QA, and Technical Writers. We are looking for candidates in the metro Atlanta area. The expectation is for this person to work 3 days from our Headquarters in Peachtree Corners, GA.


  • Important Note: Applicants for employment in the United States must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Alogent.

  • Create software designs and develop software applications according to the given requirements, ensuring compliance with design, security, performance, and usability requirements.

  • Break down user stories into component tasks and provide estimates with the assistance of more experienced engineers as needed.
  • Maintain and enhance existing product modules to ensure they function as intended.
  • Write test automation and program documentation to aid in the understanding and maintenance of software components.
  • Conduct code reviews and debugging to resolve issues and optimize performance in development and customer environments. Learn and implement best practices for memory usage, performance, and security.
  • Support product releases and provide technical support to customers as needed, including afterhours assistance to customer support team on a rotating schedule

The above statements are intended only to describe the general nature of the job and should not be construed as an all-inclusive list of position responsibilities.

  • Creative, critical thinking and a desire to learn a variety of technologies
  • .NET, C#
  • SQL Server
  • Web front-end (Javascript, HTML, CSS, JSON)
  • Object Oriented Programming (OOP) and software patterns.
  • Basic Understanding of HTTP and TCP/IP communication and user privileges for running applications
  • Basic understanding of agile software development principles, techniques, and iterative software development

PREFERRED:

  • Experience with writing tests using MSTest, NUnit or similar
  • Experience configuring windows deskop and server environments
    • Configuring IIS
    • Usage of Event Viewer and Windows Performance Monitor

  • Powershell scripting experience

What We Need
FLEETCOR is currently looking to hire a Senior Oracle DBA within our Corporate Overhead division based outside the Atlanta area. This position falls under our information security line of business. In this role, the Senior Oracle DBA will be responsible for managing our company’s Oracle database systems. In this role, you will provide database architecture and configuration expertise required to perform a modernization assessment of an existing environment and support an analysis of alternatives to modernize and stabilize the environment. This includes comparing the current environment against new methods, techniques, and industry best practices, and identifying alternative implementations.
How We Work
As a Senior Oracle DBA, you will be expected to work in a hybrid environment, coming into the office 4 days a week.

FLEETCOR will set you up for success by providing:
  • Company-issued equipment
  • Monthly home internet stipend
Role Responsibilities

The responsibilities of the role will include:
  • Database administration: Performing all aspects of Oracle database administration, including installing, configuring, upgrading, and maintenance. Ensuring the availability, performance, and security of Oracle databases within the environment.
  • Performance tuning and optimization: Analyzing and optimizing database performance through tuning activities such as query optimization, index creation, and system monitoring.
  • Identifying and resolving performance bottlenecks to ensure optimal database response times and efficient resource utilization.
  • Backup and recovery management: Developing and implementing robust backup and recovery strategies to protect critical data and ensure high availability.
  • Conducting regular database backups, performing recovery procedures, and testing backup integrity to minimize data loss and downtime.
  • Collaboration and support: Collaborating with development and infrastructure teams to provide database-related support and expertise. Assisting with database-related issues and inquiries, troubleshoot problems, and provide technical guidance on database design, schema changes, and performance optimizations.
  • Leading a team of DBAs which include technologies from Oracle DB, PostgreSQL, AWS RDS, Informix DB, Progress OpenEdge RDBMS, Microsoft Azure DB etc.
  • Team maintains On-Prem and Cloud Database 24X7 environments
  • Tune queries to improve performance; Work with developers and suggest ways to improve performance
Qualifications & Skills
  • Strong knowledge of IT development, engineering, integration, and testing processes.
  • 8+ years Oracle management
  • Experience performing all aspects of Oracle database administration (installation, configuration, upgrades, and maintenance), ensuring availability, performance, and security within the environment.
  • Candidate should have extensive MySQL experience
  • Experience analyzing, tuning, monitoring, and optimizing performance for Oracle databases.
  • Experience with backup and recovery database management/strategies
  • Experience collaborating with development and infrastructure teams on database-related support, including troubleshoot problems, and provide technical guidance on database design, schema changes, and performance optimizations.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Strong aptitude to learn and adapt to technology.
  • Effective project management, time management, and organizational skills.
  • Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with all levels in an organization.
  • Strong team interaction and collaboration skills.
  • Detail oriented with strong analytical and organizational skills.
Benefits & Perks
  • Medical, Dental & Vision benefits available the 1st month after hire
  • Automatic enrollment into our 401k plan (subject to eligibility requirements)
  • Virtual fitness classes offered company-wide
  • Robust PTO offerings including: major holidays, vacation, sick, personal, & volunteer time
  • Employee discounts with major providers (i.e. wireless, gym, car rental, etc.)
  • Philanthropic support with both local and national organizations
  • Fun culture with company-wide contests and prizes
Our Company & Purpose
FLEETCOR is a global leader in business payments, laser focused on developing smarter ways for businesses to pay their expenses. Since 2000, FLEETCOR has developed innovative digital solutions that help businesses better track, manage, and pay their expenses. Today, FLEETCOR is an S&P 500 company with hundreds of thousands of customers using our products in over 100 countries. Companies of all sizes, industries and geographies rely on our product portfolio to manage spending more quickly, efficiently and securely than ever before.
We embrace a culture grounded in five key values: integrity, collaboration, innovation, execution and people. These values offer you the opportunity to ‘thrive & grow’ through career development, volunteer, community, and wellness initiatives. This allows you to create a balance between professional goals and personal achievement.
FLEETCOR is also committed to building and nurturing a culture of diversity, inclusion, equality, and belonging by:
  • Welcoming people of different backgrounds, cultures, ethnicities, genders, and sexual orientations;
  • Empowering our people to share their experiences and ideas through open forums and individual conversations; and
  • Valuing each person’s unique perspectives and individual contributions
Embracing diversity enables our people to “make the difference” as FLEETCOR and its more than 8,000 employees continue to shape the future of global payments. Learn more by visiting www.FLEETCOR.com or following FLEETCOR on LinkedIn.
Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

Company Description

Since we opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely, and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take payments and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn’t work together.

So we expanded into software and started building integrated, omnichannel solutions – to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, offer buy now, pay later functionality through Afterpay, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. Across it all, we’ve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow in one place. Afterpay furthers our goal to provide omnichannel tools that unlock meaningful value and growth, enabling sellers to capture the next generation shopper, increase order sizes, and compete at a larger scale.

Today, we are a partner to sellers of all sizes – large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex operations, sellers just starting, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers grow, so do our solutions. There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We’re building a significant, meaningful, and lasting business, and we are helping sellers worldwide do the same.

Job Description

Square’s purpose is economic empowerment; since the company’s beginning, we have been helping numerous people start and manage their own businesses. During the pandemic, many small businesses struggled, as they scramble to adapt to going online to reach their customers.

The Orders team has a mission to enable sellers to reach their customers anywhere, and provide a seamless experience to the customers (e.g. buy online, pickup in store) that today might only be available from much larger merchants. We have already started rolling out to a small percentage of sellers, with a goal of expanding this to all sellers. Furthermore, we strive to build an Orders platform that empowers both teams at Square and an ecosystem of third-party developers to support our sellers in this bright future ahead.

This is a massive undertaking with huge challenges. We have a wide range of sellers with many different needs, and to meet those needs, we work with many stakeholder teams at Square in navigating dependencies and intertwined technical / product ambiguities. As we scale to more sellers, we also have new obstacles to overcome on performance and reliability. The team has been growing rapidly, and that has brought its own scalability challenges, so we are re-examining our rituals to support the team.

As a backend engineer on the Orders Core API team, you will help build API solutions for our first and third-party customers that support our mission of empowering our sellers to succeed by helping them throughout their entire business lifecycle. Our API solutions need to support high-volume with low-latency and be reliable.

You will:

  • Help lead the design/development of Orders API solutions that are used by first and third-party developers to interact with the orders platform
  • Lead by example and help foster a culture of positivity, psychological safety, and inclusivity within the team
  • Work with other engineers and PM’s across multiple teams to gather requirements, design, develop, test, launch, and maintain features
  • Mentor other engineers and contribute to the direction of the team
  • Provide technical expertise and guidance to other engineers (both on our team and outside of our team)
  • Help maintain and improve the processes we use to manage our work
  • Be excited to work in the middle of the Orders ecosystem and solve complex problems that require high availability and reliability
  • Be on-call for the applications our team owns

If you share our passion for this mission, and are eager to solve these complex challenges, please reach out to us!


Qualifications

You have:

  • 5+ years of industry experience designing and building APIs using Java or an equivalent language
  • Experience with, and a passion for, creating and maintaining a public API
  • Experience with complex distributed systems that require high throughput and reliability
  • Experience with orders systems (ecom, retail, restaurant, appointments, etc.) or equivalent multi component large size / scale system
  • Experience leading complex technical projects, e.g. cross-team programs
  • A strong sense of customer empathy and an interest in influencing the direction of the product
  • Excellent software engineering knowledge and the ability to provide technical mentorship and guidance.

Technologies we use:

  • Java / Guice / MySQL / Protocol Buffers / gRPC / JUnit / jOOQ / Redis / Kafka / git / Bazel / Zookeeper / AWS / DynamoDB

The ServiceNow Developer performs analysis and research of systems and networks. Reviews detailed business and technical requirements in order to recommend technical solutions. Job Description

The Product Owner is responsible for managing and guiding the organization at every step of the Product Lifecycle, from ideation to phase-out. This role is strategic, but also has multiple tactical responsibilities. It means understanding, gathering, prioritizing internal customer needs related to products, translating into product requirements, defining the product roadmap, working closely with the software product development team to deliver and introduce winning products, and further enhance and optimize as needed..

Responsibilities:

  • Acquire a deep understanding of company’s strategy as it relates to the software products we develop for internal use.
  • Create product roadmap and translate features into well-defined product requirements Including requirements, dependencies, testing plan and delivery plan.
  • Articulate a clear goal for every deployment
  • Monitor and evaluate product progress and ensure that the product delivery plan is up to date.
  • Work with key business stakeholders and end users in development of requirements
  • Partner with Developers to address Production issues.
  • Manage up-to-date release pipeline, time and estimates
  • Set the short-term delivery target based on priorities
  • Validate QA and Production Deployments

NEXT's mission is to help entrepreneurs thrive. We're doing that by building the only technology-led, full-stack provider of small business insurance in the industry, taking on the entire value chain and transforming the customer experience.


Simply put, wherever you find small businesses, you'll find NEXT.


Since 2016, we've helped hundreds of thousands of small business customers across the United States get fast, customized and affordable coverage. We're backed by industry leaders in insurance and tech, and we still have room to grow — that's where you come in.

We are looking for a driven software engineer to help us build cutting edge internal products. As an experienced innovator partnering with the growth and underwriting teams, this is a massive opportunity to help drive profitable growth.


You will be joining an innovative division of NEXT based in Atlanta: Data Labs. The mandate of Data Labs is to build software and data solutions that meaningfully impact marketing, funnel, risk, and servicing/claims experiences.


What You'll Do:

  • Empower our team of data scientists to rapidly develop and deploy ML solutions
  • Leverage software engineering best-practices to create and deploy data-intensive and machine learning inference products
  • Understand the data and dig deep to extract actionable insights
  • Think creatively and outside the box to answer desired experimental questions as well as exposing opportunities to create business value
  • Work cross-functionally with marketing, engineering, product, senior management, and external partners

What We Need:

  • 5+ years of hands-on experience in the complete software development life-cycle
  • Strong command of Python and the standard web development frameworks (e.g. Django, Flask, FastAPI)
  • Demonstrated experience building and maintaining rigorous CI/CD processes and unit and integration testing for a web service ecosystem
  • Production-grade experience with client-side front end tools (React, Vue, Angular, etc.)
  • Experience with database technologies, SQL, and Python data packages (e.g., numpy, pandas, dask, pyspark, etc.)
  • Demonstrated experience taking ideas from concept phase through implementation
  • Demonstrated experience deploying, maintaining, and monitoring models and applications to a cloud environment using tools like Docker and Kubernetes
  • Demonstrated experience with software engineering best-practices, such as Test-Driven Development and continuous integration/deployment pipelining, (bonus points for experience with GitLab)
  • Preferred 2+ years of experience in the insurance industry (strong fintech/lending experience will also be considered)
  • BS/MS in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math, or related areas

.NET Software Engineer - Global Fitness Movement - Atlanta

(Tech stack: .NET Software Engineer, .NET 7, ASP.NET, C#, React, Angular 14, Microservices, Vue.js, TypeScript, Azure, Web API 2, Agile, SQL Server 2022, Programmer, Full Stack Developer, Architect, .NET Software Engineer)

Born in 2012 in California, our client began development on an app and website that made finding and booking classes effortless for fitness goers across the state. The company is now changing how people live their lives, bringing together a community of enthusiasts, helping people find the activities that make their true selves come alive or supporting small businesses and studios across the entire globe. They believe that being active is the key to living a happy and healthy life. Our client is now active in over 15 countries and continues rapid growth on a yearly basis.

It takes a team to make things happen and this team includes some of the most talented .NET Software Engineer in the industry. They don't just have the best developers - but also the best karaoke stars, community activists and amateur chefs. Together, they are making the world an active place, which makes every day pretty damn gratifying.

They are looking for .NET Software Engineer with excellent knowledge of object orientated development principles and technologies such as: .NET, .NET Core / ASP.NET MVC, C# and SQL Server. You'll receive expert training on the latest technologies including: .NET 7, JavaScript, React, Angular 14, Microservices, MongoDB, Vue.js, TypeScript, Azure, AWS, Web API 2, Entity Framework, Node.js, Elasticsearch, Agile, TDD, BDD, Scrum, Kanban and SQL Server 2022.

  • Annual bonus.

  • Flexible work hours.
  • $10,000 training allowance.

  • Charitable giving programs.

There is no 'I' in team. By working with talented individuals and developing upon innovative ideas, the team continues to succeed and grow. They are a global movement with big plans for the future. It's an incredible opportunity so if you're interested, act and apply today!

Power Home Remodeling

We are reinventing the home remodeling industry and to do that, we need a web application platform that supports our people, our ingenuity, and our growth.

You will be empowered to make decisions and enjoy great latitude in choosing the right tools and methods for the job. Power requires a high degree of collaboration, communication and team work to achieve our goals.
Come be part of an amazing team and see what it’s like to brag about where you work.

What we do here

At Power, our technology team builds a custom suite of products that run our entire business. We create and deploy complete solutions for marketing, sales, operations, finance and more. We even have a custom communications platform that connects everyone in the company. We use cutting edge technologies like augmented reality, computer vision, machine learning, speech recognition and processing, geospatial data and a variety of mobile platforms.

We enjoy all the benefits of a startup to move fast, ship rapidly and iterate quickly, but within an established organization that is well-funded and profitable. We get to dip our toes in many different, fascinating areas and solve unique, challenging problems that could on their own be standalone apps or companies. We’re a tech powerhouse hidden inside a remodeling company.

We value diversity of all types at Power and our team is made up of a kind, thoughtful group of people with a wide range of backgrounds. We actively try to find people with different perspectives and experiences to the ones we already have.
Power has been awarded Computerworld’s Best Places to Work in IT, Fortune Magazine’s #1 Workplace for Millennials, one of Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work, one of Inc. 5000’s Fastest Growing Private Companies, and Philadelphia Magazine Coolest Companies.

Product Development at AT&T

The Product Development team at AT&T is a community of product leaders, developers, designers, and architects building new software-defined products, services, and platforms. We work at the speed of technology inside AT&T by combining the best elements of startups (scrappiness, speed, and customer focus) with the assets and benefits of the larger corporation.


Our goal is to deliver product-led growth on a massive scale – new product offerings that will stand alongside or on top of the converged AT&T 5G and fiber network.

Our approach is simple. We work backwards from customers, both consumers and enterprises, to define and build products and experiences that delight, connect, and deliver lasting value. We then bring forward innovation from the same company that invented the transistor, the solar cell, the communications satellite, and machine learning.


Whether your background is in product management, engineering, design, or something else, you’ll enter an internal community of leaders who share a similar entrepreneurial mindset.


You are a creative leader who is responsible for driving and executing design strategy for the company’s product portfolio. As a founding member of the User Experience team, you have an influential role in our user experience visions. You will work with cross-functional teams and play a critical role in *maintaining* a strong design culture that ensures every product is user-centered and loved, visually stunning, and achieves business objectives.

Responsibilities

  • Contributes to the design vision and direction for the product, from research and concept development to design and launch.
  • Partner with product managers, other designers, and stakeholders to define product requirements and design solutions that address user needs and business goals.
  • You are committed to quality and product excellence. You will help ensure that our experience visions are reflected in the final product.
  • Mentor designers, maintain a culture of creativity, learning, and continuous improvement.
  • You are a great communicator — articulate and confident. You will create and present visually compelling product video demos to leadership.
  • Actively identify and track metrics / trends relevant to the success of our product experience goals.

Qualifications

  • Experienced in delivering successful products, as well as the ability to think creatively and strategically.
  • A strong portfolio demonstrating high quality product design, ability to navigate through ambiguity, experience with creating design systems, and engaging presentation skills.
  • You have a deep understanding of design principles, design thinking methodologies, and user research.
  • Experienced with designing for complex applications.
  • Experience with Figma.
  • 10 years of experience in the Design field.
  • 8+ years of experience working collaboratively across functions: product, engineering, design, marketing, data science, and sales.

A career with us, a global leader in communications and technology, comes with big rewards. As part of our team, you’ll lead transformation surrounded by trailblazing industry leaders like you. You’ll be empowered to go above and beyond – making a difference through company-sponsored initiatives or connecting and networking through one of our many employee groups. And regardless of where you’re at in your career trajectory, you’ll be rewarded by the impact that comes with making a difference in the lives of millions. With AT&T, you’ll be a part of something greater, do incredible things and be rewarded with a chance to change the world. Strong portfolio of design projects

Background in project management and research

Familiarity with interaction design and information architecture

Proficient in design software (e.g. UXPin, Balsamiq)

Problem-solving aptitude

Excellent communication skills

About Virtusa

Teamwork, quality of life, professional and personal development: values that Virtusa is proud to embody. When you join us, you join a team of 36,000 people globally that cares about your growth — one that seeks to provide you with exciting projects, opportunities and work with state of the art technologies throughout your career with us.

Great minds, great potential: it all comes together at Virtusa. We value collaboration and the team environment of our company, and seek to provide great minds with a dynamic place to nurture new ideas and foster excellence.

Virtusa was founded on principles of equal opportunity for all, and so does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

OXOS Medical, Inc. empowers every provider with the capability, clarity, and confidence to make accurate decisions at the point of care. We are building new kinds of radiographic imaging devices that push the boundaries of previous solutions by improving image quality, reducing radiation exposure, improving ease of use, and building solutions to deliver care outside of traditional scenarios. We enable anyone anywhere to access radiologic diagnostics at the point of need, expanding availability and changing how healthcare is delivered.

OXOS Medical is constantly innovating, building on our best-in-class imaging device, and expanding into cloud-based imaging platforms, robotic guided imaging, intraoperative computed tomography, and telemedical solutions. OXOS Medical has raised $26M from prominent MedTech investors, venture capital firms, and renowned orthopedic surgeons.

OXOS Medical, Inc. empowers every provider with the capability, clarity, and confidence to make accurate decisions at the point of care. We are building new kinds of radiographic imaging devices that push the boundaries of previous solutions by improving image quality, reducing radiation exposure, improving ease of use, and building solutions to deliver care outside of traditional scenarios. We enable anyone anywhere to access radiologic diagnostics at the point of need, expanding availability and changing how healthcare is delivered.

OXOS is searching for a Creative Manager to join our high-growth company. You will join a dynamic team of passionate people who work daily to change how radiographic diagnostics are delivered. OXOS' mission is to increase access and availability using the world's first handheld Dynamic Digital Radiography Device. The mission of the Creative Manager will be to establish OXOS as the most innovative and trusted brand in the medical imaging industry by building a best-in-class creative & content platform for our brand, products, and services.

Responsibilities

As the Creative Manager, your core duties will be to:

  • Design graphics for the OXOS website, social media, and any other digital channel needs.
  • Collaborate with the marketing & sales leadership to create design templates for print, outdoor, and event collateral.
  • Partner with the product team to align and support brand and creative guidelines across all channels.
  • Create an integrated digital asset management process (DAM) across all relevant channels.
  • Assist in designing the customer journey on both the OXOS website and Platform.
  • Established personalized messaging, tone of voice, and creative strategy across all personas & channels.
  • Create a reporting dashboard that clearly articulates CX/UX roadmaps.
  • Coordinate with the product development team and support all product design needs.
  • Establish creative & design operational strategy & roadmap through December 2023.
  • Establish a professional development plan for all FTEs.
  • Create a scalable resource strategy across design contractors, agencies, and full time employees.

Qualifications and Skills

  • BS/MS in Communications, Marketing, PR or related field
  • Strong experience with Adobe Creative Cloud
  • Advanced experience with Figma
  • Proficient with Monday or similar project management software
  • Have a proactive mindset into daily operations
  • Affinity for delivering marketing materials as efficiently as possible with the ability to optimize process along the way
  • Excellent creativity and innovation skills
  • Excellent communication skills


Benefits and Perks

  • Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance
  • 401(k)
  • Competitive pay and equity in the company
  • The opportunity to work with an innovative, early-stage company that is changing medical imaging as we know it
  • Endless opportunities for growth and development

At U.S. Bank, we’re on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive at every stage of your career. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One.

Job Description

At Bento (which is now a part of the U.S. Bank family), we believe there’s a better way for businesses to manage and control expenses. We genuinely care about people in everything we do, and we are dedicated to building the best possible products and experiences at every touchpoint for our customers.

We are looking for a talented and passionate UX Design Content Strategist who can thrive in a fast-paced environment and has a vast understanding of the end-to-end design process. You will enhance our user experience with intuitive, friendly and creative content to solve our customers' needs. With your hands-on attitude, you'll work closely with the team through all parts of the design process, product development and engineering implementation.

Responsibilities

Responsible for leading and collaborating with other User Experience disciplines (Project Management Office, Research & Testing, Interaction Design, and Visual Design) to identify and execute against both the strategic and tactical content needs for various projects on multiple, interactive platforms. Provides training and guidance to content developers and stakeholders to improve understanding of and promote adoption of the content strategy model. Produces and monitors online content strategies, including voice and tone, customer and business-centric site goals, and identification and prioritization of site content. Evaluates and promotes methods to improve content lifecycle process. Analyzes, recommends and implements practices to increase efficiency and effectiveness of content development and production methods. Produces and/or supervises the creation of all deliverables (content inventories, audits, competitive reviews, content strategy briefs, content work plans, content matrices, copy documents, and optimization/lifecycle plans), as required on a project-by-project basis.

  • Deeply understand our customers and users and be their champion
  • Rewrite existing UX copy to improve engagement, retention, or conversion
  • Providing new UX copy for new features and products
  • Write micro-copy for buttons, error messages, menus and more to ensure all actions are clear, concise, and uniformed across Web and Mobile
  • Providing ideas and insights for App tone of voice and messaging
  • Analyze consumer behavior to gain user insights and identify opportunities to optimize usability
  • Partner closely with product and engineering and contribute to the product vision
  • Effectively communicate conceptual ideas and design rationale

Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree, or equivalent work experience
  • Five or more years of content strategy experience, with at least 10 years of experience in the financial industry preferred

Preferred Skills/Experience
  • Thorough knowledge of information architecture, interactive design principles, web usability, and online marketing and business needs
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively across a wide range of stakeholders in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
  • Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills
  • Proven ability to respond flexibly to changing priorities
  • Strong leadership skills

Additional Competencies

  • Degree in Writing, English, Journalism, Marketing, Communications or equivalent experience
  • Portfolio of work, ranging from high-level branding and conceptual videos to executional samples, such as social media copy, emails, infographics, articles, etc. (provide portfolio password, if required)
  • SaaS, B2B, B2C, or platform experience
  • Experience as a content writer for web, mobile, responsive, or emerging platforms
  • Previous experience writing complex, multi-functional, large-scale applications
  • Storyteller with the ability to listen, present, and sell through empathetic content
  • Ability to clearly and effectively communicate processes, ideas, rationale, and solutions to teams and stakeholders
  • Excellent interpersonal, written, and communication skills
  • Detail-oriented, user-centric mindset able to deconstruct complex issues
  • Experience with receiving and implementing feedback and constructive criticism
  • Familiar with tight deadlines, changing priorities, and multidisciplinary challenges
  • Focused on research and data-driven recommendations
  • Proactive, goal-oriented individual who takes pride in what they do
  • Entrepreneurial and intellectually curious
  • Proven experience for consumer-focused products in FinTech is a plus

#INDJC #LI-Hybrid

If there’s anything we can do to accommodate a disability during any portion of the application or hiring process, please refer to our disability accommodations for applicants.

Position Summary
The Seasonal UI/Product Designer will work with the AMB Sports & Entertainment (AMBSE) team to design and develop digital experiences and products across the various lines of business. This will include digital properties for the Atlanta Falcons, Atlanta United, and Mercedes-Benz Stadium. They will work closely with the digital operations team to coordinate execution of projects with various AMBSE departments, meeting deadlines, and ensuring high-end delivery of digital products.
Our ideal candidate will have 1-2 years of experience in digital user experience, digital product development or a similar role. This position will report to the AMBSE Director, Digital Platforms, and the assignment will run through April 2024.
Roles and Responsibilities
  • Partner with the UI/UX Designer/Developer to update and maintain digital properties across the AMBSE lines of business (MBS, Falcons, United, etc.)
  • Design pages and corresponding assets to improve
    MercedesBenzStadium.com
    and
    AtlantaFalcons.com
    user journeys, thus leading to increased conversion rates and better user experience
  • Design net-new email templates for AMBSE brands to create a more engaging and efficient visual presence within email campaigns
  • Design Atlanta Falcons / Atlanta United / MBS App pages and assets as needed for various campaigns and launches
  • Collaborate with AMBSE Technology team on user experience across innovation projects
  • Improve dynamic flow for Xenial rewards system through influenced visual asset creation

Skills and Basic Qualifications
  • 1-2 years of experience in digital user experience, product design, or similar digital role
  • Bachelor's Degree in graphic design, user interface, user experience, or related field
  • Passionate about building great products and solving customer and business problems
  • Availability to work irregular hours, including weekends and holidays as needed
  • Ability to multitask and manage various projects and the goals of multiple departments
  • Ability to meet deadlines
  • Comfortable working in a matrixed organization across media, marketing, community, sponsorship, PR, and football/soccer operations
  • Team player who thrives in projects that involve multiple stakeholders
  • Strong analytical, prioritization, and communication skills
  • Experience using content management systems (Pocket, Contentful, Webflow preferred)
  • User interface design, and experience using prototyping and design platforms such as Adobe XD / Photoshop

Preferred Qualifications
  • Base knowledge of HTML, CSS, and other front-end languages
  • Understanding of API endpoints and JSON
  • Experience managing the needs of a large organization that requires digital to meet the collective needs of cross-functional departments
  • Ability to design user interfaces and experiences rooted in graphic design fundamentals and compositional awareness
  • Experience within a large media or sports property, with an understanding of core revenue
    generating processes
